title: Ninety-Minute Cinnamon Rolls Recipe
description: These homemade cinnamon rolls are made in just 90 minutes with a quick-rising dough that's simple to make for the perfect kid-friendly sweet treat.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Bread Yeast Bread Recipes Ninety-Minute Cinnamon Rolls 4.7 (2,451) 1,953 Reviews 720 Photos Make homemade cinnamon rolls in 90 minutes with a soft, quick-rising dough. Submitted by GOOFYDEBBIE Updated on April 17, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 720 720 720 720 Prep Time: 25 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Additional Time: 40 mins Total Time: 1 hr 30 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 12 rolls Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings ¾ cup milk ¼ cup margarine, softened 3 ¼ cups all-purpose flour ¼ cup white sugar 1 (.25 ounce) package instant yeast ½ teaspoon salt ¼ cup water 1 large egg 1 cup brown sugar, packed ½ cup margarine, softened 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon ½ cup raisins (Optional) Directions Heat milk in a small saucepan until just hot to touch or a few bubbles form around the edge. Remove from heat and stir in margarine until melted; set aside. Combine 2 1/4 cups flour, white sugar, yeast, and salt in a large bowl. Add milk mixture, water, and egg; beat well. Add remaining 1 cup flour, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring well after each addition. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth, about 5 minutes. Cover with a damp cloth and let rest for 10 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios While dough is resting, mix together brown sugar, margarine, and cinnamon in a small bowl. Set aside. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin pan. Roll dough out on a lightly floured surface into a 12x9-inch rectangle. Spread brown sugar mixture over dough; sprinkle with raisins. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Roll up dough and pinch seam to seal. Cut into 12 equal rolls. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place cut-side up in the prepared muffin cups. Cover and let rise until doubled, about 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until browned, about 20 minutes. Remove rolls from muffin cups to cool on a wire rack. Serve warm. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 3,736 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 347 Calories 13g Fat 55g Carbs 5g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 347 % Daily Value * Total Fat 13g 16% Saturated Fat 2g 12% Cholesterol 17mg 6% Sodium 262mg 11% Total Carbohydrate 55g 20% Dietary Fiber 2g 6% Total Sugars 27g Protein 5g 10% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 54mg 4% Iron 2mg 12% Potassium 160mg 3% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Ninety-Minute Cinnamon Rolls 01 of 720 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 720 Photo by  Novice Tim 12/26/2023 A few things I learned. When you roll up the dough and some of the filling oozes out, don't just smear it on the outside. Some of that may drip off in the oven and cause the smoke alarm to go off and also may make the rolls look a bit unsightly. The flavor was fine though. I also melted the butter for the brown sugar mixture and then later tried to harden it up in the fridge. I should have just let the butter soften instead. That would have helped with the rolling of the dough. Will make again. 03 of 720 Photo by  Heather 12/03/2023 I made the recipe as written. This was my first time trying to make cinnamon rolls and they came out great. Will definitely make again. 04 of 720 Photo by  Outtathyme 06/25/2023 Easy to follow recipe and tastes fantastic. I like to frost with butter cream cheese icing. 05 of 720 Photo by  Daisy Louis 03/09/2023 I have used this recipe many times.Sometimes putting my own spin on it.Fantastic recipe 👌 06 of 720 Photo by  JazzyYolk3556 01/10/2023 I used real butter and added pecans. I also made a carmel sauce and poured it over the top of the rolls as soon as they came out of the oven. Fantastic very tasty!!😊😊 07 of 720 Photo by  lmski2012 12/25/2022 We loveddd it! I accidentally added double the butter to the dough so I was worried when I realized my mistake, but it turned out great. I made them on a deep cookie sheet baked at 350 for 22 minutes.These were for Christmas breakfast, memories were made and this will be a new tradition, thanks for sharing the recipe! Definitely a new favorite. 08 of 720 Photo by  Hot tea 12/25/2022 After my third attempt, these came out perfect! I checked the temperature of the milk this time and allowed additional time for rising. Next time I will cook covered for 1/2 time as the tops got pretty well done.5 stars! 09 of 720 Photo by  RowdyKnife1813 12/25/2022 This recipe is wonderful. First time making Cinnamon Buns ever and they came out so well. Family has asked me to make them a regular item now. Thank you for this!Very easy , I hand mixed the dough with ease.I should add , I made them in an oblong glass dish , cooked 20 mins ! It cooked evenly,, 10 of 720 Photo by  T.S. Holt-McGraw 11/27/2022 Perfect bake - beautiful rise. I added pecans to my drunken raisins to create a gooey center with a bit of that lovely nutty crunch. I used half the brown sugar called for and added a couple tablespoons of Stevia brown sugar to reduce the calories. Also made a simple icing with Swerve confectionery. This morning's easy and fun bake was impulsively prompted by my morning coffee-hour reading of "Legends & Lattes." I could smell the cinnamon rolls coming out of Travis Baldree's words on the pages of the book so I had to go make some. Now my house smells like the setting in the book. Allrecipes dot com is always my go to when I want a hand to hold if I'm cooking/baking something unfamiliar. This was a hit. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Cinnamon Rolls 1,779 Ratings Overnight Cinnamon Rolls I 459 Ratings Unbelievable Rolls 994 Ratings Savory Cinnamon Rolls 109 Ratings Moist Cinnamon Rolls 121 Ratings Soft Cinnamon Rolls 367 Ratings Buttermilk Cinnamon Rolls 491 Ratings Mrs. Baker's Sticky Cinnamon Rolls 20 Ratings Betty's Famous Cinnamon Rolls 77 Ratings Cinnamon Crown Rolls 5 Ratings Cinnamon Rolls II 747 Ratings Herman Cinnamon Rolls 26 Ratings Nutty Cinnamon and Currant Pumpkin Rolls 1 Rating Sufganiot 5 Ratings Healthier Clone of a Cinnabon 14 Ratings Chocolate Banana Bread 1,355 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: GOOFYDEBBIE
instructions: Heat milk in a small saucepan until just hot to touch or a few bubbles form around the edge. Remove from heat and stir in margarine until melted; set aside.;Combine 2 1/4 cups flour, white sugar, yeast, and salt in a large bowl. Add milk mixture, water, and egg; beat well. Add remaining 1 cup flour, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring well after each addition.;Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth, about 5 minutes. Cover with a damp cloth and let rest for 10 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;While dough is resting, mix together brown sugar, margarine, and cinnamon in a small bowl. Set aside.;Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin pan.;Roll dough out on a lightly floured surface into a 12x9-inch rectangle. Spread brown sugar mixture over dough; sprinkle with raisins. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Roll up dough and pinch seam to seal. Cut into 12 equal rolls. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Place cut-side up in the prepared muffin cups. Cover and let rise until doubled, about 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Bake in the preheated oven until browned, about 20 minutes. Remove rolls from muffin cups to cool on a wire rack. Serve warm. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
